title: Sweet Potato Pie
description: Shared from a Southern recipe, this homemade sweet potato pie is easy to make with boiled sweet potato. Try it, it may just be the best you've ever tasted!
instructions: Place whole sweet potato in pot and cover with water; bring to a boil. Boil until tender when pierced with a fork, 40 to 50 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Remove sweet potato from the pot and run under cold water. Remove and discard skin.

Break sweet potato flesh apart and place in a bowl. Add butter and mix with an electric mixer until well combined. Add sugar, milk, eggs, nutmeg, cinnamon, and vanilla; beat on medium speed until mixture is smooth. Pour filling into unbaked pie crust.
Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, 55 to 60 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool before serving.

title: Classic Spaghetti Bolognese
description: A rich and meaty sauce served over a bed of fresh spaghetti. A true Italian classic.
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package directions.
In a large skillet, cook ground beef and onion over medium heat until beef is browned.
Stir in garlic, tomatoes, and oregano. Season with salt and pepper.
Simmer for at least 1 hour.
Serve sauce over cooked spaghetti.

title: Spicy Chicken Tacos
description: Quick and easy chicken tacos with a spicy kick. Perfect for a weeknight dinner.
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into strips
instructions: In a bowl, toss chicken with chili powder.
Cook chicken in a skillet over medium-high heat until cooked through.
Warm tortillas.
Serve chicken in tortillas with your favorite toppings.

title: Hearty Lentil Soup
description: A comforting and nutritious lentil soup, spiced with traditional Indian flavors.
instructions: Combine lentils, broth, and turmeric in a pot.
Bring to a boil, then simmer for 30-40 minutes until lentils are soft.
In a small pan, toast cumin seeds until fragrant.
Stir cumin seeds into the soup and garnish with cilantro.

title: Quick Beef Stir-fry
description: A savory beef and broccoli stir-fry that's faster than takeout.
ingredients: 1 head of broccoli, cut into florets
instructions: In a wok or large skillet, heat sesame oil over high heat.
Add beef and cook until browned.
Add broccoli and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes.
Stir in soy sauce and serve immediately over rice.

title: Unrated Experimental Dish
description: An experimental dish with an unknown rating. For testing NaN values.
instructions: Combine ingredients.
Cook until done.

title: Simple Caesar Salad
description: A classic Caesar salad with a creamy homemade dressing.
instructions: Chop romaine lettuce and place in a large bowl.
Add croutons and Parmesan cheese.
Drizzle with dressing and toss to combine.

title: Blueberry Muffins
description: Moist and fluffy blueberry muffins, perfect for breakfast or a snack.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, mix flour and sugar.
In another bowl, beat eggs and milk.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
Gently fold in blueberries.
Fill muffin cups and bake for 20-25 minutes.

title: Fresh Guacamole
description: A simple and delicious guacamole made with fresh, high-quality ingredients.
instructions: Mash avocados in a bowl.
Stir in onion, lime juice, and cilantro.
Season with salt.

title: Creamy Butter Chicken
description: A rich and creamy chicken curry, milder than other Indian curries but full of flavor. NaN total time for testing.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for at least 1 hour.
Cook chicken in a large pan until browned.
Add tomato puree, butter, cream, and garam masala.
Simmer for 15-20 minutes until the sauce has thickened.

title: Simple Boiled Rice
description: A basic recipe for boiled rice. Testing NaN prep and cook times.
instructions: Rinse rice under cold water.
Combine rice and water in a pot.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes.

title: Classic Beef Burger
description: The all-American classic beef burger, juicy and full of flavor.
instructions: Form ground beef into 4 patties.
Season with salt and pepper.
Grill or pan-fry patties to desired doneness.
Melt a slice of cheese on top of each patty during the last minute of cooking.
Serve on buns with toppings.
